parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

datasetStructure: One record per test per specimen per observation time per subject or pool

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.POOLID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used for pooling subjects to assign a single finding to multiple subjects. If POOLID is entered, POOLDEF records must exist for each subject and the USUBJID must be null. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.
datasetVariables.label: Pool Identifier
datasetVariables.name: POOLID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSEQ

datasetVariables.description: The sequence number must be unique for each record within a USUBJID or POOLID, whichever applies for the record.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: PCSEQ

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject or pool. This is not the treatment group number.
datasetVariables.label: Group Identifier
datasetVariables.name: PCGRPID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCREFID

datasetVariables.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: 1009570101.
datasetVariables.label: Sample Identifier
datasetVariables.name: PCREFID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference identifier.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: PCSPID

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the analyte (or measurement) described in PCTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PCTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PCTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
datasetVariables.label: Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: PCTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCTEST

datasetVariables.description: Long name for PCTESTCD, such as the name of the analyte (or measurement). The value in PCTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.
datasetVariables.label: Test Name
datasetVariables.name: PCTEST

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of the pharmacokinetic test performed. Examples: ANALYTE, METABOLITE, SPECIMEN PROPERTY.
datasetVariables.label: Test Category
datasetVariables.name: PCCAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of a test category.
datasetVariables.label: Test Subcategory
datasetVariables.name: PCSCAT

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCORRES

datasetVariables.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Findings as Collected
datasetVariables.name: PCORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85494

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCORRESU

datasetVariables.description: The unit for the original result. The unit of the original result should be mapped to a synonymous unit on the Controlled Terminology (http://www.cdisc.org/terminology) list.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Original Result
datasetVariables.name: PCORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from PCORRES in a standard format or standard units. PCSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be submitted in numeric format in PCSTRESN. Results beyond limits of quantitation should be represented with the term "BLQ" for results below the limit and "ALQ" for results above the limit.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Character Format
datasetVariables.name: PCSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for numeric results or findings in standard format; contains the numeric form of PCSTRESC. PCSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. For results beyond limits of quantitation, this variable should be left null (e.g., if PCSTRESC is "BLQ", PCSTRESN would be null).
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Numeric Format
datasetVariables.name: PCSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85494

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for PCSTRESC and PCSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Standardized Result
datasetVariables.name: PCSTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate when a test is not done or result is missing. Should be null if a result exists in PCORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: PCSTAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why PCSTAT is NOT DONE, such as SPECIMEN LOST.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Done
datasetVariables.name: PCREASND

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCNAM

datasetVariables.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor providing the test results.
datasetVariables.label: Laboratory Name
datasetVariables.name: PCNAM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C77529

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSPEC

datasetVariables.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: SERUM, PLASMA, URINE.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Material Type
datasetVariables.name: PCSPEC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSPCCND

datasetVariables.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Examples: HEMOLYZED, ICTERIC, LIPEMIC.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Condition
datasetVariables.name: PCSPCCND

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCSPCUFL

datasetVariables.description: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. Should be "N" if the specimen is not usable; otherwise it should be null.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Usability for the Test
datasetVariables.name: PCSPCUFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCMETHOD

datasetVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: HPLC/MS, ELISA. This should contain sufficient information and granularity to allow differentiation of various methods that might have been used within a study.
datasetVariables.label: Method of Test or Examination
datasetVariables.name: PCMETHOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCBLFL

datasetVariables.description: A baseline indicator may be used to calculate differences or changes from baseline. Value should be "Y" or null. The baseline flag is sponsor-defined.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: PCBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCFAST

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. The value should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Fasting Status
datasetVariables.name: PCFAST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: PCDRVFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCLLOQ

datasetVariables.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units should be those used in PCSTRESU.
datasetVariables.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
datasetVariables.name: PCLLOQ

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCEXCLFL

datasetVariables.description: "Y" if the result should be excluded from all calculations, otherwise null.
datasetVariables.label: Exclusion Flag
datasetVariables.name: PCEXCLFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCREASEX

datasetVariables.description: The reason the result should be excluded from all calculations. Used only when PCEXCLFL is "Y".
datasetVariables.label: Reason for Exclusion
datasetVariables.name: PCREASEX

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCUSCHFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicates whether the timing of the specimen collection was unscheduled. If a specimen collection was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
datasetVariables.name: PCUSCHFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned day of collection. Should be an integer.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Collection
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of specimen collection, in ISO 8601 format. If there is no end time, this will be the collection time.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: PCDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCENDTC

datasetVariables.description: End date/time of specimen collection, in ISO 8601 format. If there is no end time, the collection time should be represented in PCDTC, and PCENDTC should be null.
datasetVariables.label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: PCENDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCDY

datasetVariables.description: Study day of specimen collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: PCDY

modelClassVariable.title: Study Day of End of Observation

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Study Day of End of Specimen Collection

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCENDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Specimen Collection

datasetVariables.description: Study day of the end of specimen collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in DM domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of End of Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: PCENDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCNOMDY

datasetVariables.description: Nominal study day used for grouping records for specimen collections that may occur on different days into a single reported study day. Should be an integer.
datasetVariables.label: Nominal Study Day for Tabulations
datasetVariables.name: PCNOMDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCNOMLBL

datasetVariables.description: A label for a given value of PCNOMDY as presented in the study report. Examples: "Week 4", "Day 28".
datasetVariables.label: Label for Nominal Study Day
datasetVariables.name: PCNOMLBL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCTPT

datasetVariables.description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. \n Note: This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See PCTPTNUM and PCTPTREF. Examples: Start, 5 min post.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: PCTPT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of PCTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: PCTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601 format) relative to a planned fixed reference (PCTPTREF) such as "Day 1, Dose 1". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "PT0H" to represent any predose values; "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by PCTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: PCELTM

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by PCELTM, if used for PCTPTNUM, and PCTPT. It is recommended that PCTPTREF be as descriptive as possible so the reference time point can be inferred without looking at other variables. Example: "Day 1, Dose 1".
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: PCTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of the reference time point, PCTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Point
datasetVariables.name: PCRFTDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable PC.PCEVLINT

datasetVariables.description: Planned evaluation interval associated with a PCTEST record in ISO 8601 format. Example: "-P2H" to represent a planned interval of collection of 2 hours prior to the time point described in PCTPT.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluation Interval
datasetVariables.name: PCEVLINT

description: A findings domain that contains concentrations of drugs or metabolites in fluids or tissues as a function of time. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, SDOMAIN, C49606, 2018-06-29)
label: Pharmacokinetic Concentrations
name: PC
